results.question: List all employees in the Sales department
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, e.email, e.phone, e.hire_date, p.title FROM departments d JOIN employees e ON e.department_id = d.department_id JOIN positions p ON p.position_id = e.position_id WHERE d.name = 'Sales' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many employees were hired in 2024?
What is the average salary by department?
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.department_id, d.name AS department_name, AVG(e.salary) AS average_salary FROM departments d JOIN employees e ON e.department_id = d.department_id GROUP BY d.department_id, d.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all customers with credit limit over $100,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id, c.name, c.credit_limit FROM customers c WHERE c.credit_limit > 100000;

results.question: How many sales orders are in pending status?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM sales_orders WHERE status = 'pending' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all products in the Electronics category
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.sku, p.name, p.description, p.unit_cost, p.list_price, p.weight FROM product_categories pc JOIN products p ON p.category_id = pc.category_id WHERE pc.name = 'Electronics' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the names of all warehouses?
results.sql_generated: SELECT name FROM warehouses LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all active vendors
results.sql_generated: SELECT vendor_id, vendor_number, name, email, phone, website, address_id, payment_terms, currency_id, tax_id, is_active, created_at FROM vendors WHERE is_active = TRUE LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different account types in the chart of accounts?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT account_type_id FROM chart_of_accounts LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all bank accounts and their current balances
results.sql_generated: SELECT ba.bank_account_id, ba.account_number, ba.account_name, ba.current_balance FROM bank_accounts ba LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many projects are currently active?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM projects WHERE status = 'Active' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all fixed assets with their purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.asset_id, fa.name, fa.purchase_cost FROM fixed_assets fa LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are all the available leave types?
results.sql_generated: SELECT name FROM leave_types LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all training courses that are mandatory
results.sql_generated: SELECT name FROM training_courses WHERE is_mandatory = TRUE LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different opportunity stages?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT name FROM opportunity_stages LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all countries in the system
results.sql_generated: SELECT name FROM countries LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many departments are there?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(department_id) AS total_departments FROM departments LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all units of measure
results.sql_generated: SELECT name, abbreviation FROM units_of_measure LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What fiscal years exist in the system?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT year FROM fiscal_years LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different asset categories?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT name FROM asset_categories LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees who have been with the company for more than 5 years and earn above $100,000
results.sql_generated:
SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, e.email, e.phone, e.salary, eh.company_name, eh.start_date 
FROM employees e 
JOIN employment_history eh ON e.employee_id = eh.employee_id 
WHERE (CURRENT_DATE - eh.start_date) > INTERVAL '5 years' AND e.salary > 100000 LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: operator does not exist: integer > interval

results.question: List employees and their managers' names
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id AS employee_id, e.first_name AS employee_first_name, e.last_name AS employee_last_name, m.first_name AS manager_first_name, m.last_name AS manager_last_name FROM employees e JOIN employees m ON e.manager_id = m.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Which employees have pending leave requests?
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employees e JOIN leave_requests lr ON e.employee_id = lr.employee_id WHERE lr.status = 'Pending' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the number of employees per position title
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.title, COUNT(e.employee_id) AS employee_count FROM positions p JOIN employees e ON e.position_id = p.position_id GROUP BY p.title LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees with expiring certifications in the next 6 months
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, c.name AS certification_name, ec.expiry_date FROM employee_certifications ec JOIN certifications c ON ec.certification_id = c.certification_id JOIN employees e ON ec.employee_id = e.employee_id WHERE ec.expiry_date BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '6 months' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total sales amount by customer for 2024?
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    c.customer_id,
    SUM(so.total) AS total_sales
FROM 
    sales_orders so
JOIN 
    customers c ON so.customer_id = c.customer_id
WHERE 
    EXTRACT(YEAR FROM so.order_date) = 2024
GROUP BY 
    c.customer_id;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: List the top 10 customers by total order value
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id, c.name, SUM(s.total) AS total_order_value FROM sales_orders s JOIN customers c ON s.customer_id = c.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_id, c.name ORDER BY total_order_value DESC LIMIT 10;

results.question: Show sales opportunities in the Negotiation stage worth over $50,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT so.opportunity_id, so.name, so.customer_id, so.owner_id, so.stage_id, so.amount, so.probability, so.expected_close_date, so.actual_close_date, so.source, so.created_at FROM sales_opportunities so JOIN opportunity_stages os ON so.stage_id = os.stage_id WHERE os.name = 'Negotiation' AND so.amount > 50000 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the conversion rate from quotes to orders?
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    (COUNT(DISTINCT sales_orders.order_id) / COUNT(DISTINCT quote_lines.quote_id)) * 100 AS conversion_rate
FROM 
    quote_lines
JOIN 
    sales_quotes ON quote_lines.quote_id = sales_quotes.quote_id
JOIN 
    sales_orders ON sales_orders.quote_id = sales_quotes.quote_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List sales orders by sales representative with their totals
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    s.sales_rep_id,
    e.name AS sales_rep_name,
    SUM(s.total) AS total_sales
FROM 
    sales_orders s
JOIN 
    employees e ON s.sales_rep_id = e.employee_id
GROUP BY 
    s.sales_rep_id, e.name;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Which products have inventory below their reorder point?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name, i.quantity_on_hand, r.reorder_quantity FROM products p JOIN reorder_rules r ON p.product_id = r.product_id JOIN inventory_levels i ON p.product_id = i.product_id WHERE i.quantity_on_hand < r.reorder_quantity LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show total inventory value by warehouse
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    w.warehouse_id,
    w.name AS warehouse_name,
    SUM(il.quantity_on_hand * p.price) AS total_inventory_value
FROM 
    warehouses w
JOIN 
    inventory_levels il ON w.warehouse_id = il.warehouse_id
JOIN 
    products p ON il.product_id = p.product_id
GROUP BY 
    w.warehouse_id, w.name;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: List products that had stock transfers in the last 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name FROM products p JOIN transfer_lines tl ON p.product_id = tl.product_id JOIN stock_transfers st ON tl.transfer_id = st.transfer_id WHERE st.transfer_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total spend by vendor this year?
results.sql_generated:
SELECT SUM(vendor_invoices.total) AS total_spend
FROM vendor_invoices
JOIN purchase_orders ON vendor_invoices.po_id = purchase_orders.po_id
JOIN vendors ON vendor_invoices.vendor_id = vendors.vendor_id
WHERE vendor_invoices.invoice_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '1 year' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List purchase orders that are overdue (expected date passed but not received)
results.sql_generated: SELECT po.po_id, po.po_number, po.expected_date, gr.receipt_date FROM purchase_orders po LEFT JOIN goods_receipts gr ON gr.po_id = po.po_id AND gr.receipt_date > po.expected_date WHERE gr.receipt_date IS NULL AND po.expected_date < CURRENT_DATE LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the approval rate for purchase requisitions
results.sql_generated: SELECT (COUNT(CASE WHEN purchase_requisitions.approved_by IS NOT NULL THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) * 1.0 / COUNT(purchase_requisitions.requisition_id)) AS approval_rate FROM purchase_requisitions LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total debit and credit for each account in the current period?
results.sql_generated: SELECT ba.account_number, SUM(CASE WHEN bt.transaction_type = 'Debit' THEN bt.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_debit, SUM(CASE WHEN bt.transaction_type = 'Credit' THEN bt.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_credit FROM bank_transactions bt JOIN bank_accounts ba ON bt.bank_account_id = ba.bank_account_id WHERE bt.transaction_date BETWEEN (SELECT start_date FROM fiscal_periods WHERE is_closed = false LIMIT 1) AND (SELECT end_date FROM fiscal_periods WHERE is_closed = false LIMIT 1) GROUP BY ba.account_number;

results.question: List all posted journal entries for the current month
results.sql_generated:
SELECT je.entry_id, je.entry_number, je.entry_date, je.description, je.reference, je.posted_by, je.status, je.created_at 
FROM journal_entries je 
WHERE je.posted = TRUE AND date_trunc('month', je.entry_date) = date_trunc('month', CURRENT_DATE) 
LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column je.posted does not exist

results.question: Show budget vs actual spending by department
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.department_id, d.name AS department_name, SUM(b.total_amount) AS total_budget, SUM(pb.actual_amount) AS total_actual_spending FROM departments d JOIN budgets b ON b.department_id = d.department_id LEFT JOIN project_budgets pb ON pb.budget_id = b.budget_id GROUP BY d.department_id, d.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total expense amount per project?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.project_id, SUM(pe.amount) AS total_expense_amount FROM projects p JOIN project_expenses pe ON pe.project_id = p.project_id GROUP BY p.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List projects that are over budget
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.project_id, p.name, pb.planned_amount, SUM(pe.amount) AS total_expenses FROM projects p JOIN project_budgets pb ON p.project_id = pb.project_id LEFT JOIN project_expenses pe ON p.project_id = pe.project_id GROUP BY p.project_id, p.name, pb.planned_amount HAVING SUM(pe.amount) > pb.planned_amount LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show project resources and their allocation percentages
results.sql_generated: SELECT pr.project_id, pr.employee_id, pr.role, pr.allocation_percent FROM projects p JOIN project_resources pr ON pr.project_id = p.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List fixed assets by category with their total purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT ac.name AS category_name, SUM(fa.purchase_cost) AS total_purchase_cost FROM fixed_assets fa JOIN asset_categories ac ON fa.category_id = ac.category_id GROUP BY ac.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List assets due for maintenance in the next 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.asset_id, fa.name, fa.description, am.scheduled_date, mt.name AS maintenance_type FROM fixed_assets fa JOIN asset_maintenance am ON fa.asset_id = am.asset_id JOIN maintenance_types mt ON am.maintenance_type_id = mt.type_id WHERE am.scheduled_date BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many documents are attached to each entity type?
results.sql_generated: SELECT entity_type, COUNT(*) AS document_count FROM document_attachments GROUP BY entity_type LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate employee turnover rate by department for 2024
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    d.department_id,
    d.name AS department_name,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN e.termination_date IS NOT NULL THEN 1 END) AS terminated_count,
    COUNT(e.employee_id) AS total_count,
    (COUNT(CASE WHEN e.termination_date IS NOT NULL THEN 1 END) * 100.0 / COUNT(e.employee_id)) AS turnover_rate
FROM 
    employees e
JOIN 
    departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id
WHERE 
    EXTRACT(YEAR FROM e.termination_date) = 2024
GROUP BY 
    d.department_id, d.name;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Find the salary percentile ranking for each employee within their department
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, d.department_id, d.name AS department_name, es.amount AS salary, NTILE(100) OVER (PARTITION BY e.department_id ORDER BY es.amount) AS salary_percentile FROM employees e JOIN employee_salaries es ON es.employee_id = e.employee_id JOIN departments d ON d.department_id = e.department_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Identify employees who have not completed mandatory training
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employees e JOIN employee_training et ON e.employee_id = et.employee_id JOIN training_courses tc ON et.course_id = tc.course_id WHERE tc.is_mandatory AND et.status != 'Completed' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate month-over-month sales growth rate for the past 12 months
Find the average order value and order frequency for each customer segment based on credit limit
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id, c.name, AVG(s.total) AS avg_order_value, COUNT(s.order_id) AS order_frequency FROM sales_orders s JOIN customers c ON s.customer_id = c.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_id, c.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the sales pipeline weighted value by stage and expected close month?
results.sql_generated: SELECT os.stage_id, oss.name AS stage_name, date_trunc('month', os.expected_close_date) AS expected_month, SUM(os.amount * os.probability) AS weighted_value FROM sales_opportunities os JOIN opportunity_stages oss ON os.stage_id = oss.stage_id GROUP BY os.stage_id, oss.name, expected_month LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate inventory turnover ratio by product category
results.sql_generated: SELECT pc.category_id, pc.name AS category_name, SUM(il.quantity_on_hand) / COUNT(it.transaction_id) AS inventory_turnover_ratio FROM inventory_transactions it JOIN products p ON it.product_id = p.product_id JOIN product_categories pc ON p.category_id = pc.category_id JOIN inventory_levels il ON il.product_id = p.product_id GROUP BY pc.category_id, pc.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Identify products with significant inventory discrepancies (adjustment > 10% of stock)
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name, SUM(al.quantity_change) AS total_adjustment, il.quantity_on_hand AS current_stock FROM inventory_adjustments ia JOIN adjustment_lines al ON al.adjustment_id = ia.adjustment_id JOIN products p ON p.product_id = al.product_id JOIN inventory_levels il ON il.product_id = p.product_id GROUP BY p.product_id, p.name, il.quantity_on_hand HAVING ABS(SUM(al.quantity_change) / NULLIF(il.quantity_on_hand, 0)) > 0.1 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate vendor performance score based on on-time delivery and invoice accuracy
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    v.vendor_id,
    v.name AS vendor_name,
    AVG(pr.rating) AS average_performance_rating,
    SUM(CASE WHEN vi.due_date <= CURRENT_DATE THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) * 1.0 / COUNT(vi.invoice_id) AS on_time_delivery_rate,
    SUM(CASE WHEN vi.amount_paid = vi.total THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) * 1.0 / COUNT(vi.invoice_id) AS invoice_accuracy_rate
FROM 
    vendors v
JOIN 
    vendor_invoices vi ON v.vendor_id = vi.vendor_id
LEFT JOIN 
    performance_reviews pr ON v.vendor_id = pr.employee_id AND CURRENT_DATE BETWEEN pr.review_period_start AND pr.review_period_end
GROUP BY 
    v.vendor_id, v.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Generate a trial balance for the current period showing debits and credits by account category
results.sql_generated: SELECT at.category, SUM(CASE WHEN bt.transaction_type = 'Debit' THEN bt.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_debits, SUM(CASE WHEN bt.transaction_type = 'Credit' THEN bt.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_credits FROM bank_transactions bt JOIN account_types at ON bt.transaction_type = at.category WHERE bt.transaction_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '1 month' GROUP BY at.category LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate cash flow from bank transactions grouped by transaction type and month
results.sql_generated: SELECT bt.transaction_type, date_trunc('month', bt.transaction_date) AS transaction_month, SUM(bt.amount) AS cash_flow FROM bank_transactions bt GROUP BY bt.transaction_type, date_trunc('month', bt.transaction_date) ORDER BY transaction_month, transaction_type LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate project profitability comparing budget vs actual expenses
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    p.project_id,
    b.budget_id,
    SUM(b.planned_amount) AS planned_budget,
    SUM(e.amount) AS actual_expenses,
    (SUM(b.planned_amount) - SUM(e.amount)) AS profitability
FROM 
    project_budgets p
JOIN 
    budgets b ON p.budget_id = b.budget_id
JOIN 
    project_expenses e ON p.project_id = e.project_id
GROUP BY 
    p.project_id, b.budget_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column b.planned_amount does not exist

results.question: Find resource allocation by employee across all active projects
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, pr.project_id, pr.role, pr.allocation_percent, pr.start_date, pr.end_date FROM project_resources pr JOIN employees e ON pr.employee_id = e.employee_id WHERE e.is_active = TRUE LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all fixed assets with their assigned employees and current locations
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.asset_id, fa.asset_tag, fa.name, fa.description, fa.category_id, fa.location_id, fa.assigned_to, fa.purchase_date, fa.purchase_cost, fa.vendor_id, fa.po_id, fa.serial_number, fa.warranty_expiry, fa.status, fa.disposal_date, fa.disposal_amount, fa.created_at, el.name AS location_name, e.first_name AS assigned_to_first_name, e.last_name AS assigned_to_last_name FROM fixed_assets fa JOIN asset_locations el ON fa.location_id = el.location_id JOIN employees e ON fa.assigned_to = e.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Create a comprehensive employee cost report including salary and benefits by department
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.department_id, d.name AS department_name, SUM(es.amount) AS total_salary, COUNT(eb.benefit_id) AS total_benefits FROM departments d JOIN employees e ON e.department_id = d.department_id JOIN employee_salaries es ON es.employee_id = e.employee_id LEFT JOIN employee_benefits eb ON eb.employee_id = e.employee_id GROUP BY d.department_id, d.name LIMIT 1000;
